name: stats
description: Legacy Event Search function for aggregating query output. In CrowdStrike Query Language (LogScale), use groupBy() instead with aggregate functions. This function name is included for reference and migration purposes.

parameters.name: Note
parameters.description: This is a legacy function. Use groupBy() with aggregate functions like count(), sum(), avg(), min(), max(), etc.

examples: // Legacy: | stats dc(aid) as uniqueEndpoints, count(aid) as totalExecutions by SHA256HashData
// CQL: | groupBy([SHA256HashData], function=([count(aid, distinct=true, as=uniqueEndpoints), count(aid, as=totalExecutions)]))
notes: This function is from Legacy Event Search (Splunk-style). In LogScale/CQL, use groupBy() with aggregate functions instead.
